author: mercya1
title: Expand Access to Extend Cardano
description: ++Dans les régions où l'électricité et la pénétration de l'Internet sont insuffisantes, comment les populations locales peuvent-elles aider à réaliser le potentiel et les solutions de Cardano ?

f6_assessments.q0: Expanding the Catalyst community by creating community hubs to provide basic internet services aligns with Cardano's mission. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: This challenge partially overlaps with other challenges using various means to attract new members. The budget for this challenge is about 75% higher than the other challenges so there is some minor concern about the capacity of the community to address this challenge. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate the demonstrated demand for the proposed budget (most easily done based upon excess total proposal budgets in previous funding rounds).
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are measurable and exceptionally well defined.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge only partially serves one of the strategic goals for Fund 8 "Prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem." Although I do not think expanding access is the quickest way to reach this goal. Besides, there are already several ongoing projects (like World Mobile) addressing this issue. I disagree that this challenge is critical to Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1: This challenge is stated as a quite closed problem: expanding access to Cardano by extending electricity and internet access. Even if I think that the community does have the skills to make proposals in this area, I do not expect this challenge to receive many good quality proposals. I neither agree nor disagree that the community has the capacity to effectively address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposed metrics (number of new community centers and members) measure the expansion of access to Cardano's environment. If voted, this challenge would have a reasonable auditability through these criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: This fund challenge setting could have a large impact on areas where accessibility to blockchain are challenging.  This challenge setting would look to enable proposals that target the main infrastructure challenges that remote and/or rural areas face with getting connected to Cardano (i.e. internet/electricity).
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of this fund setting could be challenging as most infrastructure problems are quite large and the funding requested for this challenge may not be enough to truly enable a large enough population to build and sustain growth.
f6_assessments.q2: This project could have the ability to enable auditing measures in regards to development of infrastructure as well as determining the amount of enabled people per project that will now have access to something like Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree with this Challenge setting . We need resources to setup Grassroots hubs. But at the same time it should not be where WADA and other established groups like East Asia dominate and take all the funds. They should be excluded from this since they already have their own challenges which can accomodate all these hubs and everything else. This should be open to those countries or regions which dont have their own challenges like South Asia Central Asia Middle east, Oceanic Islands etc.  THis would have a huge impact on society so that we can create income generating oportunity as well as stake pools in rural areas. I strongly disagree that this should again favor Africa as Africa has their own challenge and lot of support already there. We need support in south and central asia, west asia, oceanic islands.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget is reasonable but i strongly stand by not allowing other existing groups to dominate things in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics are clear and include Number of hubs/community centres with back-up and stable power supply with high-speed internet access, designed to maintain a stake pool operation
Number of hubs/community centres with space and equipment for classes and work
Number of new community members onboarded (e.g. devs, enterprises, thought leaders etc.)
Feedback on progress from successful proposals regardless of failure or success
Novelty and appropriateness of solutions (hard to quantify, easy to see)
Proposals should come from countries with 50% or less internet penetration.

f6_assessments.q0: To create a challenge setting basically to fund infrastructural needs for designated hubs every funding rounds to extend the reach of cardano is not a worthwhile venture as this does not really guarantee cardano ecosystem outreach to the so called unbanked because it is not a means to an end and it really does not focus on cardano outreach objectives. Moreover some of  challenge brief is already been addressed by other campaigns within the catalyst
f6_assessments.q1: The community is capable of providing the solutions to ensure that the objectives of the challenge are effectively resolved.
f6_assessments.q2: The challenge has provided enough metrics to effectively assess and monitor its performance.

importance: Sans soutien, les difficultés d'accès à l'électricité et à l'internet entraveront le potentiel global de Cardano et son objectif de bancariser les personnes non bancarisées.
success: Créer des centres communautaires dotés de ressources suffisantes dans les communautés locales afin de résoudre les problèmes locaux liés à Cardano et de développer le marché de Cardano.
